headline: Warner Bros. Split Leaves Bondholders With Painful Choices
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Just three years after selling one of the biggest high-grade corporate bonds on record, Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. is giving noteholders the type of tough choices more typically faced by holders of stressed junk bonds. headline: Barclays says Warner Bros. upside depends on recapitalization
summary: Barclays analyst Kannan Venkateshwar says Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) formally announced a split of the company into two, which has been expected by investors since it announced a restructuring of the company into two divisions last year. The company has $37B of gross debt and another $5B of off balance sheet debt and neither standalone entity will have enough EBITDA to absorb this on a standalone basis without a significant increase in leverage, the analyst tells investors in a research note.

raw.headline: Barclays says Warner Bros. upside depends on recapitalization

The company has $37B of gross debt and another $5B of off balance sheet debt and neither standalone entity will have enough EBITDA to absorb this on a standalone basis without a significant increase in leverage, the analyst tells investors in a research note.

headline: Noodles & Company's New Menu Features "Food Network Favorites" Curated Selections
summary: Noodles & Company (NASDAQ: NDLS), the fast-casual favorite known for its globally inspired noodle bowls, has partnered with Food Network, the authority in all things flavor, to unveil four entrees that have been crowned "Food Network Favorites." This partnership between two established leaders celebrates the creativity, culinary craftsmanship, and unbeatable value that Noodles & Company is known for, now curated by some of the most trusted experts in the industry.

headline: Heard on the Street: Warner Discovery Splitting Up
summary: What happened in markets yesterday: Export controls were at the top of the trade agenda. As U.S. and Chinese delegates met in London, American negotiators were expected to press Xi Jinping’s representatives to speed up exports of rare-earth minerals and magnets.
